historical_summary: Initially struggled with the rigors of college computer science courses at NYU, expressing frustration with coding assignments and questioning the relevance of certain subjects.
Showed an interest in blockchain and cryptocurrency after overhearing conversations about crypto and blockchain, leading to self-education in trading and finance.
Landed a summer internship in quantitative finance through family connections, which sparked an interest in quant trading.
Engaged in online trading communities like Wall Street Bets, indicating a growing fascination with financial markets.
Recently, took a leave of absence from college to pursue a full-time role at a quant firm after an interview went exceptionally well.
